f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (06:55): You sure you want to take on this syntax highlighting module?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (06:55): The parsing process is hella daunting.
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (06:55): i mean why not
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (06:55): God knows how many scenarios you have to take into consideration.
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (06:56): we can set it as a public library
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (06:56): You end up tagging the hell out of a simple java file, making it like 10x the size of the original.
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (06:56): mhh what do you think ?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (06:57): Like the first possible line: package sue.me.roo.me;
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (06:58): that will become a node
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (06:59): Ends up being <java-keyword>package</java-keyword><java-package> sue.me.roo.me</java-package><java-punc>;</java-punc>
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (06:59): Notice the white space in <java-package>.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:00): You need to tag every possible string in the file so later on when you convert it to HTML, you can assign a color to its fond.
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:00): <newline nr="0" ><reserved type="1" name="package" value="sun.me.roo.me">  </newline>
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:01): type 1 will than be used to define the css
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:01): Or that having too many attributes make it hard to modularize.
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:02): mhh agree
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:02): Besides, how do you represent public final static String myStr = new String("blah");?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:03): Hmm... What happened to ";" by the way?
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:03): oups
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:03): <newline nr="0" ><reserved type="1" name="package" value="sun.me.roo.me" eol=";">  </newline>
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:04): Well, what if you have package sue.me.roo.me; /* here we go again */ import my.lovely.pkg.OhGod;
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:04): All on a single line.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:04): I'm telling you, it's a pain.

b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:05): <newline nr="0" reserved type="1" name="package" value="sun.me.roo.me" eol=";" comment="here we go again" reserved=1 name="import" value="my.lovely.pkg.OhGod" eol=";">  </newline>
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:06): Hah, ok, but XML design is not an issue at this point. You can come up with various structures.
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:07): Uviz,  im aware that it is pain we could enjoy the hack for a while and improve the design of xml tags and ...
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:07): My argument is that categorizing such syntax is extremely complex.
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:08): we can have a look at how others are doing it and learn from them
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:08): lool
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:09): We need the code for java compiler.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:10): You need a complete java language specification to parse a .java file.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:10): And who wants to read through all the semantics.

f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:24): I wrote a small program back in school that would convert java text files into hex.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:25): But the file still compiles even though it all looks gibberish.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:25): I ran the entire project, 50 files, against it and committed to the repository.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:26): The next day all my teammates frantically ran into me saying the project has gone smoke in the air.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:27): Then I realize, if it wasn't for the revert feature of control version, I would have had to write a hex->java class.

f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:28): I was inspired do write it because of a question I'd seen in JSCP where the variable name was actually converted to hex and the questioneer was asked whether it was legal.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:30): Ok, I gotta drink something.
